identificationModule.officialTitle: Treatment of Complex Pilon Fractures: A Pilot Study Comparing Primary Arthrodesis (PA) to Open Reduction and Internal Fixation (ORIF)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This project intends to compare patient outcomes between patients undergoing ORIF compared to PA, or ankle fusion, following an acute pilon fracture. Limited literature comparing ORIF and ankle fusion as a primary procedure exists. Particularly, no present literature exists examining the novel arthrodesis surgical technique utilized in this study in conjunction with Opal sensor gait analysis data. This study will serve as a pilot study and assess patient gait, degree of pain, functional outcome scores, development of post-traumatic arthritis and/or infection, need for secondary surgery, and return to work time.

armGroups.label: Open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF)
armGroups.description: Patient has underwent ORIF to repair a pilon fracture.

armGroups.label: Primary arthrodesis (PA; ankle fusion)
armGroups.description: Patient has underwent PA/ankle fusion to repair a pilon fracture.

primaryOutcomes.description: Inversion and eversion range, and flexion versus extension range determined by the use of the Opal sensors
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Collected only once; from 6 months post-op up to date of death from any cause

primaryOutcomes.description: Steps per minute as determined by the use of the Opal Sensors
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Collected only once; from 6 months post-op up to date of death from any cause

primaryOutcomes.description: Time it takes to stand from seated, walk 10 feet forward, turn around, and sit back down, unassisted (determined by the use of the Opal sensors).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Collected only once; from 6 months post-op up to date of death from any cause

primaryOutcomes.description: Foot and ankle injury patient reported outcome measure (Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better foot and ankle surgical outcomes)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Collected only once; from 6 months post-op up to date of death from any cause

primaryOutcomes.description: Patient reported outcome measures regarding health and daily activities (Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better physical and mental health functioning)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Collected only once; from 6 months post-op up to date of death from any cause

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Presence of infection and/or post-traumatic arthritis
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of patients being rehospitalized or returning for care beyond what is required due to infection or arthritis
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the date of surgery up until the date of death from any cause

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients that required follow up surgery to their initially injured ankle
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the date of surgery up until the date of death from any cause

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of weeks it took for patients to return to work
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From the date of surgery up until the date of death from any cause

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria: Individuals receiving ORIF or PA for a multifragmented acute pilon fracture occuring at the joint surface over the age of 18 from 2018 to present at The University of Kansas Medical Center (KUMC) or Emory University Hospital.

Exclusion Criteria: Anyone under the age of 18 years. Pregnant women.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Individuals over the age of 18 that have undergone an ORIF or PA surgery for an acute pilon fracture at either KUMC or Emory University Hospital.

locations.facility: The University of Kansas Medical Center
